intro: Columbia subaequalis, commonly known as the Columbia subaequalis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
